T
he  cyclone  storm,  named  “Remal”  (pronounced  “Re-Mal”)  over  the  North  Bay  of  Bengal,
intensified into a severe cyclone storm at 05.30 a.m. on May 26. It is located near 19.5°N and
89.3°E, to the north-east of Sri Lanka, and 1500 km away from Kankasanthurai. It is very likely
to move nearly northwards, intensify further, and cross Bangladesh and adjoining West Bengal
Very  strong  winds  (60-70)  kmph,  accompanied with heavy  rainfalls  and  very  rough  seas  are
likely over the sea areas around the country and over the South-eastern Arabian Sea areas and
